image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: The ramping crisis which first emerged in Adelaide 15 years ago is "not about people coming in with a cut finger" but a global issue requiring broader solutions than bigger hospitals, an inquest into the deaths of three people has heard.

title.children: 'I can't breathe': Inquest into ramping reveals extent of crisis in South Australia with 'no simple solution'

image.altText: Virat Kohli plays a cover drive

props.synopsis: Indian megastar Virat Kohli has returned to form and now has returned to his favourite ground in cricket, Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Virat Kohli is in form, fired up, and heading to his favourite ground in the world

image.altText: A paper list of household costs, with money and a coffee on the side of the paper.

props.synopsis: Would you ask your children to pay to stay at home? As many Australians navigate tricky conversations about cost of living pressures, some say it needs to start with an open and honest discussion about household finances.

title.children: More young people staying at home longer as some chip in with rent, household costs and chores

image.altText: a speed sign saying gravel roads require a max speed of 80 kilometres per hour

props.synopsis: A farmer living in rural South Australia has recently helped several drivers out of sticky situations along the unsealed roads near his home. He says they've been led astray by the GPS directions.

title.children: Travellers urged to be more cautious of GPS directions when it comes to unsealed roads

image.altText: Baby Kobi sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: The "main issue" for police handling domestic violence matters is finding a way to encourage coercive control victims to confide in them when non-contact orders have been breached, a senior police officer has told the inquest into the murder-suicide of Kobi and Henry Shepherdson.

title.children: Senior police officer tells inquest DV victims must be encouraged to report non-contact breaches

image.altText: A graphic of a speed limit for a 90kph zone.

props.synopsis: Driving in later life can bring its own challenges, and while rules around older road users vary widely across the country, options for navigating those challenges include licence assessments and conversations around so-called "driving retirement".

title.children: What are the rules for older Australian drivers?

image.altText: A boy with brown curly hair wearing a navy polo shirt holds a white model of a spikey puffer fish.

props.synopsis: 3D printing technology is revolutionising the way that blind and low-vision students learn about the world around them.

title.children: How 3D models are becoming a 'game changer' for vision-impaired students

image.altText: man in van with mobile phone sitting on lap

props.synopsis: Mobile detection cameras have so far caught thousands of drivers using their phones illegally in Adelaide. But some have discovered you might still be doing the wrong thing, even if you are not touching your phone with your hands.

title.children: 'I was quite shocked': Drivers in Adelaide receive fines, demerit points for resting phones on laps

image.altText: The sun beams through buildings on Adelaide's Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: With parts of the country already sweltering though heatwaves, support services are worried many people will not be able to afford to keep cool this year.

title.children: Above-average summer temperatures prompt concerns more Australians at risk of heat-related injuries

image.altText: Powerlines built through a clearing in a forest

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is urgently seeking to restart two mothballed diesel-powered generators as it warns the state is at risk of blackouts this summer.

title.children: SA government seeks new powers to get diesel generators back online ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: A photo of a regional city with trees and power lines in the foreground

props.synopsis: Nearly 13,000 customers lost power across the far west of NSW this morning after a fault in the electricity network. Some businesses say the uncertainty was too much after experiencing rolling blackouts in October.

title.children: Outback NSW region beset by rolling blackouts for several weeks loses power again

image.altText: A man in a suit with purple tie pauses as he speaks

props.synopsis: On Monday night at the Sydney Institute, Paul Fletcher ripped off a fiery denunciation of the "teals" – the independent candidates who two and a half years ago tore a significant hole in the ranks of the parliamentary Liberal Party.

title.children: Liberal sees red over teals, but look deeper and there's more at play

image.altText: A Qatar Airways plane taxis along the tarmac at Melbourne Airport, on a dark night.

props.synopsis: After arriving on a late-night flight under police guard, Perry Kouroumblis is set to face court later today over the alleged double murder of two Melbourne women in 1977.

title.children: Easey Street murder suspect to face charges of murder, rape after extradition

image.altText: Zhalin Cecil works with young boys at risk of perpetrating violence.

props.synopsis: Experts say comprehensive one-on-one early intervention programs are having positive outcomes for young males at risk of becoming adults perpetrators of family violence.

title.children: 'I became the bully of bullies': Violence in childhood can lead boys to become violent men

image.altText: A sign on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: Workplace Relations Minister Murray Watt urges Woolworths and the United Workers Union to reach an agreement to bring an end to industrial action which has led to stock shortages on supermarket and liquor store shelves.

title.children: Government urges Woolworths and union to end dispute now affecting Dan Murphy's

image.altText: Cbus super logo on a glass window

props.synopsis: Millions of Australians will be able to tap their super fund for more financial advice about their retirement and superannuation, under changes being announced by the federal government, but they will have to pay for the benefit.

title.children: Cbus urged to review how it spends members' money, as government gives green light to super funds to charge for financial advice

image.altText: A selfie of a man with his face blurred

props.synopsis: Anne and a man she had met online messaged every day for weeks. Their chat history shows how scammers emotionally and psychologically manipulated her — and stole $46,000.

title.children: 'You've destroyed me': A 'pig butchering' scam drained a 26-year-old Australian of $46,000

image.altText: A large waterfall surrounded by green rainforest. A rainbow can be seen in the mist of the crashing water.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has linked the Australian businessmen behind Papua New Guinea's largest agroforestry project to key figures in a massive Indigenous land grab scandal in the country's Western Province more than a decade ago.

title.children: Australian businessman linked to 'land grab' scandal behind $1.8b PNG forest deal, ABC investigation finds

image.altText: A bowl of bright green powder.

props.synopsis: Matcha's vibrant colour and health benefits have made it a new fad food, fuelling a surge in demand that is outpacing supply.

title.children: Australian cafes and suppliers say matcha demand outpacing supply

image.altText: A close up image of Adam Bandt at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Greens leader has put the prime minister on notice that his party would seek "in advance" to lock in a "stable and progressive" deal with Labor to form a potential minority government.

title.children: Bandt reveals vision for 'effective and progressive' minority power-sharing deal with Albanese

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has already started making threats that could kick off a trade war with the world's second-largest economy. But Beijing has been laying the groundwork for the prospect of another battle for some time.

title.children: Trump will likely restart his trade war with China, but this time Beijing is ready

image.altText: Taweechai Thongrod uses distilling equipment to check his alcohol.

props.synopsis: After the deaths of six young backpackers, including two Australians, due to methanol poisoning in Laos, a distiller explains how untrained or unscrupulous brewers can easily create a deadly concoction.

title.children: After the methanol poisoning tragedy, this distiller explains the fine line between a good and deadly spirit

image.altText: Chinese businessmen Ming Yang and Wong Sheng with Alan Kropp from Australian Country Choice holding a cut of beef.

props.synopsis: An Australian beef exporter caught up in a trade war with China says the company has learned not to become overly reliant on a single market.

title.children: Beef exporter says it will take time to resume trade with China as sanctions lift

image.altText: Older woman looking out into distance from balcony

props.synopsis: A retired IT worker, designer and postie have struggled for years to find an affordable home on the NSW Mid North Coast. Now they're preparing to move into a new rental unit in the heart of beautiful Bellingen.

title.children: Million-dollar views for $245 a week as at-risk women over 55 find a place to call home

image.altText: A woman with slicked back hair, has a serious expression, she's in her early 40's

props.synopsis: An Australian Army veteran has told a public hearing into the Queensland government's proposed "adult crime, adult time" laws she felt safer serving overseas than living in Townsville.

title.children: Army veteran says she feels safer in overseas riot zone than in Townsville

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A mixed session on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks lower, while the Australian Bureau of Statistics is set to release the third-quarter GDP data at 11:30am AEDT.

title.children: ASX falls ahead of third-quarter GDP data, Wall Street mixed

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CBUS board told to lift governance

image.altText: People waiting in line to view a rental property

props.synopsis: Experts say while it does look like the market is cooling, any decrease in prices is still a long way off for renters.

title.children: Australia's rental market beginning to cool, but relief is still a long way off

image.altText: A Bunnging Warehouse beneath a patchy sky.

props.synopsis: The millet brooms were imported from China and a former rice farmer says he "nearly fell over" when he saw one on the hardware giant's shelf in the heart of Australian rice-growing country.

title.children: Bunnings probes potential biosecurity issue after rice plant apparently found in imported broom

image.altText: a beekeeper lifts a wax rack up towards his covered face

props.synopsis: Cody Hannover says he wants to hire other people with "quirks" at his thriving honey business as expands online.

title.children: Outback beekeeper sees potential to expand by hiring other NDIS clients

image.altText: Sam Alderton-Jones smiles while taking a selfie with his daughter and a dog on a beach.

props.synopsis: Father of five Sam Alderton-Jones focuses on "quality over quantity" on school holidays — both for family and work.

title.children: 'You can't do anything perfect': Parents on juggling work on school holidays

image.altText: Ryan Kobayashi and two women hold pictures of missing woman Hannah Kobayashi.

props.synopsis: Hannah Kobayashi has been seen crossing into Mexico alone with her luggage and is no longer is considered missing, according to police.

title.children: Hannah Kobayashi no longer a missing person after being spotted entering Mexico

image.altText: a woman fastens a young child into a car seat

props.synopsis: One in four of the 123 children who died in road crashes between 2004 and 2023 weren't restrained at all — even by an adult seatbelt.

title.children: Child restraint laws to be reviewed as experts warn Australia lags behind other countries

image.altText: An old baggy green is held by a gloved hand

props.synopsis: The baggy green Australian Test cap worn by Sir Donald Bradman in his last home series in 1947-48 has sold at auction for close to half a million dollars.

title.children: Don Bradman's baggy green sold for nearly $500,000 at auction

image.altText: A woman stands on a road caked with mud in front of a destroyed home after a flood

props.synopsis: More than 30 people have been killed in the flooding which was caused by heavy rains in the region in the past week, with communities facing a significant rebuild also preparing for more rain this weekend.

title.children: Deadly flooding in Malaysia and southern Thailand sees people urged to reconsider travel
